isPersianLeapYear

public boolean isPersianLeapYear()
Determines if the given year is a leap year in persian calendar. Returns true if the given year is a leap year.

Returns:
boolean

getPersianShortDate

public java.lang.String getPersianShortDate()
Returns:
String of persian date formatted by 'YYYY[delimiter]mm[delimiter]dd' default delimiter is '/'

addPersianDate

public void addPersianDate(int field,
                           int amount)
add specific amout of fields to the current date for now doesnt handle before 1 farvardin hejri (before epoch)

Parameters:
field -
amount - 
  Usage:
  addPersianDate(Calendar.YEAR, 2);
  addPersianDate(Calendar.MONTH, 3);
u can also use Calendar.HOUR_OF_DAY,Calendar.MINUTE, Calendar.SECOND, Calendar.MILLISECOND etc
